I had a difficult time reproducing the bug.  However, I managed to 
produce the same NPE by putting the build.properties source page in a bad state
and then trying to use the form page to delete the library.

(1) Add 'library.jar' to table viewer
(2) Switch to 'build.properites' source page
(3) Manually delete lines containing 'library.jar' taking care to remove 
    any continuation characters [,\] from the preceding lines
(4) Switch to 'Build' form page
(5) Delete 'library.jar'

Benno, is this how you reproduced the bug?  
If not, is your scenario reproducible?  And if so, what is it?
Also, let me know if your build.properties source page contains any warnings
or errors.

In any event, I added a check for null when searching for the build entry
to delete.

Patch released to HEAD.
Patch:  patch_184188_2007-04-26_13-49.txt

(In reply to comment #1) 
> (1) Add 'library.jar' to table viewer
> (2) Switch to 'build.properites' source page
> (3) Manually delete lines containing 'library.jar' taking care to remove 
>     any continuation characters [,\] from the preceding lines
> (4) Switch to 'Build' form page
> (5) Delete 'library.jar'
> 
> Benno, is this how you reproduced the bug?

This sounds very likely. I did edit the build.properties on the source page and deleted library entries in source before the NPE was thrown.

Fixed. Patch released to HEAD.

Patch:   patch_184188_2007-04-27_13-21.txt
Target:  3.3 M7

Added another guard to allow the library to be deleted from the table viewer,
when a partial deletion was done in the source view.

Noticed some source page reconciliation problems that will have to be
addressed post 3.3
